Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good sleep, Great for business and family & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Warempage
Reviews.Content: I stayed in many different hotels in Paris and also tried most of the hotels of the Intercontinental group in Paris, from the Interconti Le Grand Paris, Crown Plaza Republique to many other holiday inns. This was the first time in the HI Express Canal de la Villette and was pleasantly surprised. Location: Along the canal, which was nice and I think especially in summer it must be fun to go for a stroll. Riquet Metro Station a few minutes away; 10 mins from central Paris, few stops from Gare de l'Est. Cinema a few steps away and quite a few nice restaurants around. Rooms: I had an upgrade as platinum member to the 6th floor with balcony and view on the canal. The room was clean, big enough, flat screen tv and beds comfy. Spacious shower which had lots of pressure. Desk with Internet Cable & Sofa Bed. No wardrobe cupboards, but hangers and open cupboard to put your clothes. (as in many HIE hotels) Breakfast: Is included and buffet style. Croissants, Baguettes, cereal, scrambles eggs & sausages, ham, chicken, cheese.... etc. It's ok, no change in the 4 nights I stayed though. Internet: As almost everywhere in France... is paid. Wired from the rooms and wireless from the lobby (however my room 607 reached the wifi). Think wifi was 3 hours for 5€ and wired about 15€ a day Parking: YES! for 15 euro p.n. safely under the hotel. I just parked my car and used the metro to get around city centre the 4 days I was there. I will come back and this place is perfect for business as well to go with family & kids. Moreover it is good value for money; booked via the hotel website for 108 Euro a night. Try to find that in Paris (for the same quality in a nice area) .... A word of caution when travelling in the metro: Keep your wallet safe especially around Chatelet station. Thieves are so crafty you wont notice and in a split second thieves manage to get your wallet. Yes this happened to me... even I am used to travel taking the metro a lot.... Luckily someone saw my wallet on the floor and I got it back. The thieves were able to (only) take out the euro bills, left the pounds and thank god I still had my cards and driver license.... Hope you found this information useful :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Doug B
Reviews.Content: Very nice and spacious hotel room. I haven't stayed in any other hotels in Paris but I suspect this is a very large room comparatively. (I've stayed in rooms less than half this size in New York City.) Bed was comfortable. The bed size is referred to by the hotel as a "double" but it is about the size of an American California King. Shower was great - hot and strong. Breakfast was excellent. Coffee, both American-brewed and a machine that automatically makes cappuccino. Buffet also offered breads/croissants, sliced cheese and ham, cereals including some kind of granola and what appeared to be Count Chocula, and eggs and sausages. Location was not central but I appreciated it. There are many non-touristy restaurants in the neighborhood. A few minor drawbacks that prevented a 5 rating: the lighting in the room was insufficient and it is slighly dark in the evening. This may be due to the "eco" slant of the hotel, I'm not sure. There was not enough storage space for me to empty my suitcase for a 4-night stay. I paid with Priority Club points plus cash, $60 cash + 5000 points per night. I believe they have raised the number of points required and this terrific deal is no longer available.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ives m
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless. I loved the tea and coffe facilities in the room. The bathroom does not give the idea that somebody has used it before, firstly because of everything being so new and very clean. The view from the rooms is amazing and is also close to metro station, local shops but bigger supermarkets as well. I would have preferred to be closer to the center though as there are plenty of stops with the metro to reach the center.

Reviews.Title: “High Standard for Paris”
Reviews.Author: VideoMedia Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed with colleague and clients and although out of the way a bit in terms of city centre, its locality to the Seine and excellent standard more than made up for it. Highly recommend for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: helibeli74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to spend some reward points and were not disappointed. Came to Paris on Eurostar and only took about 10 minutes on the Metro (to Riquet with 1 change at Stalingrad) from Gare du Nord Fantastic service from reception staff who gave us some local restaurant advice for lunch and evening which we took (A lunch at La Bastringue (on the way to the Riquet metro) and an evening meal at Draco which was fantastic. Hotel itself was in great condition and it was so quiet and peaceful. We were lucky to get a canal view room which was brilliant - you can see the groups of men playing boules on the canalside and rowing on the weekends. We'd read reviews about breakfast being a bit chaotic but we didn't experience that. Yes the tables were quite close together and I could imagine if it was full it could get very busy but you are warned in the information about potential waiting times (we didn't have to wait). There were hot sausages and scrambled eggs then a cold meat and cheese selection as well as cereals, breads, croissants and pain au chocolats. The single toaster was the only hiccup as queues were building for that. But didn't bother us - we just had extra croissants! We loved the area as it wasn't touristy at all (and hence a bit cheaper!) but it was still quick to get into central Paris if you're able to get the Metro.The local area is being redeveloped and I think lots of new places will be popping up all over the place. One of the best things we did was go to the Hammam du Canal which was behind the hotel. Spent 3 hours being steamed, exfoliated, wrapped in mud, saunaed, resting with Moroccan tea/pastries and then a massage. It's a new hammam and has mixed days on Saturday but if you're escaping to Paris for a rest as leaving children behind like us then this is a definite must! Will definitely stay here whenever we come to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Wide open space: A rarity in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MsBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Not being a city person, I really appreciated this hotel's location on a beautiful, wide portion of a canal lined with trees and great walking/running/dog playing areas. If you have children, they might enjoy the freedom and relief from the rest of crowded Paris. It's a "green" building, too, with some interesting architectural features. There's a fantastic, old-fashioned drawbridge right behind the hotel. The staff was very friendly, patient with my attempts to speak French, and always helpful when I had questions. The rooms are simply furnished and decorated, but the real attraction is being able to look and walk outside. I recommend the Crimee metro station rather than Riquet at night. Caution: if you are alone, it can be a bit intimidating in the area at night. Make the effort to figure out the metro and bus systems: Bus route 54 stops along Rue de Flandres (where you get the metro) and goes right by Gard du Nord, and then up to Pigalle, Blanche & Clichy, the Moulin Rouge/Sacre Coure neighborhoods! If you buy a "carnet" of 10 bus tickets at Gare du Nord, you can use each for one-way with transfers. Or, buy a "mobilis" good for unlimited rides for one day. Much cheaper than paying for a tour bus! Free bus maps at the info kiosk. Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: shediver
Reviews.Content: Everything at the hotel was better than we expected. We had a room with a great view overlooking the canal. It was very efficient, clean, quiet, comfortable. The shower was spacious. Breakfast was good with an assortment of choices. There is only one coffee machine but there is fresh coffee kept in carafes next to the machine and also steamed milk. I found this to be just as good as the coffee from the machine and I didn't have to wait for the machine! The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They had no problem speaking English, helping us find our way around the metro system, offering dinner choices. We found the neighborhood to be very safe and interesting with many food options, nearby grocery, convenient Metro and bus stations are just a block and a half away. Would definitely recommend. Important tip: If you are using taxis, check out the taxi fare calculator like World Taximeter, and get directions before your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Some days in Paris using award points”
Reviews.Author: IceBossMoscow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by Priority club award points, and our room was upgraded to large canal view room. Matrass was too soft for me, at the morning I had not very good feelings, but of course it's very subjective. Just at home I used to sleep on harder bed. Also one more thing we didn't like - it's too dark at the room: imho, it's not comfortable with small wall lamps. Internet is available by LAN, 30 minutes per day is free by low speed. No minibar at the room. Hotel is situated in 15 minutes ride by metro from the center (Opera). Almost the same distance and time to walk from/to metro stations Riquet and Crimee. Near Riquet there's a big supermarket (Casino); on Crimee station there're some restoraunts, mostly Asians (vietnamese, japanese, chinese). Breakfast is included to the room price. From hot selections there're sausages and something cooked from cheese and probably eggs. Coffee is good, from coffee-machine. Very tasty croissants, but it's everywhere is Paris :) There're a lot of runners on the side of Canal at mornings.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is nice, clean, roomy, convenient, quiet, with good view and in safe location.”
Reviews.Author: BL75025
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel from 12/24/11-12/31/11. We enjoyed their good service in very polite and professional manner. The breakfast room was packed especially during peak hours. The only one gourmet coffee machine was the most popular spot. People lined up to get fresh cappuccino or latte. Our room is big enough for 3 people and with beautiful canal view. The staffs were pleasant and cheerful all the time. The only thing we missed is bath tub for our long walking feet after various sight-seeing and museum visiting. We also found Macdonald, good Chinese and Japanese restaurants near by the next metro station after Riquet.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Mel L
Reviews.Content: European hotels are notoriously small--or so I've heard. So that's what I was expecting, and I'm glad the hotel exceeded by expectations in that sense. Enough room for 3 people to sleep comfortably in and share a bathroom. Very clean, very organized, and very economical; i.e., the room space is efficiently used and extraneous things such as closets and dressers are cut out and replaced with a tiny clothes rack with (rather annoying to use) hangers. The front desk and concierge are good people--very patient with requests: I desperately wanted to try a Michelin restaurant so the front desk graciously made a ton of calls for me. The breakfast was pretty shoddy, not gonna lie. The chef seemed to get lazier and lazier each day as there were progressively fewer choices the longer we stayed. E.g. there was yogurt, cream cheese, granola, scrambled eggs and sausage the first day, and all that whittled down to just 2-3 of those by the end. And since I love fresh fruit, it killed me that all they had was the canned stuff drowned in nasty syrup. If you're looking for somewhere quiet and safe, this is a good hotel. The neighborhood is mostly residential and there is a police station right around the corner, in case anything does happen. The Riquet metro station is only a 5-min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StephaneBrussel
Reviews.Content: Nice "eco" hotel on the canal! (nothing fancy) Nice local neighbourhood, with bars and restaurants...citybikes in front of hotel (20 min to la Bastille) and metro closeby (5min walk). One minus: breakfast is included, but if you go late it's very badly organised.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, a week before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: hvintila
Reviews.Content: I and my friend went to Paris for a week.We found a Paris ready for the great holiday, with shops and stores beautifully adorned, Parisian-way decorated, with tourists feverishly flocking to enter the Musee d”Orsay as well as the many other famous museums of the CAPITAL of the Capitals, la VILLE LUMIERE... We were accomodated at a comfortable hotel: Holiday Inn Express,Paris-Canal de la Villette.The pleasant stay here contributed a lot to our visit. It offered us everything we wanted: much silence, cleanliness and politeness of the staff. Last and not least important was the ECO FRIENDLY design and architecture of the building. Another aspect not to be neglected has been its location of 3 minutes only away from the subway. I greatly reccommend all my friends, relatives and acquintances coming here this very friendly, nice, cosy, hospitable hotel. As there are only a few hours separating the whole World from entering a new year, I fondly wish everybody and the TRIP ADVISOR TEAM, a Prosperous Happy New Year 2012 !!! Une Nouvelle Bonne Annee !!! Peace to the World, A Blessed Happy New Year !!! Horia Vintila Oradea, Romania

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alanby_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay over Christmas in this hotel with my partner. We booked it based on lots of reviews on this site, majority were very positive, the only negative comments I feel were from people being very very picky. This is an exceptionally clean modern well run 3* hotel in a quiet but lovely location, 3 min walk to the Riquet Metro station, from where you can get to anywhere in Paris very quickly. I had taken on board lots of comments from other guests and requested a spacious room on a higher floor with a canal view. I had also requested an early check in if at all possible as we would be arriving at about 11am. All my requests were met with in a freindly professional manner, nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff, day or night. If you want value for money, quiet location, short 3 min walk to the Metro, immaculate modern bedroom and bathroom, powerful shower, very comfortable bed, clean crsip white bedding, more than adequate breakfast included in the rate, friendly staff.....then book this hotel. If you are used to 4 or 5* hotels, with all the extras, then you may be disappointed. But who on earth wants to stay in the hotel when the whole of Paris is within a 15 minute Metro ride? In fact, we walked to Sacre Couere and Montmartre in about half an hour. This hotel is perfect for a great nites sleep, and for starting your day with a decent breakfast. We paid about 90euro per nite inc breakfast on Expedia, the rack rate was 160 without breakfast. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: CRogenmuser
Reviews.Content: We were coming to this hotel from a very bad hotel, so maybe I am being optimistic...but this hotel was great! It was very clean, had decent sized rooms, great housekeeping, pleasant staff, and a good (free) breakfast every morning. The closet space was lacking, but other than that I didnt have a bad thing to say about this hotel. It was a short walk from the Crimee Metro stop, which took us to every location we wanted to see in Paris for only 1.20E each ride. We would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PattiSmithfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 4 minutes from the metro with a handy all night store en route. The staff were very friendly and efficient and I would recommend thi hotel with its lovely views and large comfortable rooms. My room looked all the way up the canal towards the rotunda near the Stalingrad metro station and overlooked the houseboats moored in the canal basin. The tree lined avenue alongside was used by the locals to play boules and the two cafe bars nearby were ideal for a late night drink/coffee. Easy access to Paris by metro and a real feeling that you were not surrounded by tourists but were seing a genuine slice of French life. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel although some people might not like the walk from the station at night as it is quite dark (albeit it is past the police station).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent buffet breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Stevethepeeve
Reviews.Content: Was really surprised at the nice location near a canal marina in an interesting working class area. Nearby supermarkets and subway. Hotel very nice with big rooms. Lobby internet a bit slow and printer is backlogged. Front office staff speak english and are very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Bored from Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pune_nik
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 6th - 11th November. Close to Metro, nice location. Cleanliness was good. Staff was good in English which was helpful. Only thing which troubled was the same breakfast for 6 days. Even when we asked for boiled eggs they told "sorry, not possible".

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a few days in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: KernowTravellers10
Reviews.Content: A lovely location by the canal which In late June was full of life, great for an evening stroll and enough restaurants close by the hotel (the hotel only serves breakfast). Being so close to a Metro station meant easy access to the centre of Paris, and a couple of times we walked (about half an hour) to the Gare du Nord to pick up the tourist bus. We were very pleased with the room, but we had to wait a couple of hours after the stated check-in time - time we could have spent sightseeing! The excuse was that the hotel was full the day before (they seem to have plenty of business conferences there). That is really no excuse at all, and it would have been nice to have been offered some refreshments while we were waiting. That aside, the hotel staff were generally very friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast was good, but over the 4 days we were here they often ran out of some items if you didn't get down to the breakfast room early enough! However, we would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Paris”
Reviews.Author: snath06
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very comfortable rooms. Metro station is a 5 minute walk and some good small eating joints (including Indian & Chinese) nearby that are useful after a long tiring day of site seeing. The only thing we would have loved was some changes on the breakfast menu - exactly same for 4 mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a Paris short break”
Reviews.Author: Rojo447
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris at the beginning of October primarily to go to the horse racing at Longchamp. The hotel is located in a residential area in north east Paris. It is only a short direct bus ride from the Gare du Nord Eurostar station and is also near the Metro. The hotel itself is fairly modern with a small bar and restaurant that only serves breakfasts. We found the hotel reception staff very professional and most spoke good English. However, the bar staff were very surly and everything seemed too much trouble for them. The rooms were modern and clean. The rooms we stayed in all had a double bed and a sofa bed. One of our party had their 13 year old son with them who was able to stay at no extra cost. There is a fish restaurant adjacent to the hotel, La Criee, which we dined at on our first night. There are also a few bars and other restaurants fairly near - our favourite was the Cafe OK which was just the other side of the canal. We found the area very safe and enjoyed mingling with the friendly Parisienes in the local bars. I would highly recommend this hotel for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: JohnMcUK
Reviews.Content: Paris has a reputation for the more boutique style Hotel, individually stylised and generally smaller than the International trademark. Holiday Express is less boutique, more standard, in a vibrant area of North East Paris. It is well located with the Metro providing quick and wide reach across the city and with good dining potential on the doorstep (although not notably the Hotel itself). The hotel provides a basic but decent level of service: a decent room of decent size, decent reception area & decent breakfast. No frills. When we first arrived we were checked into 2 adjoining rooms (as expected) only one of the rooms was already occupied ! Not a good start and really quite embarassing all-round. Have to say however that the hotel worked hard to sort out the problem and went out of their way thereafter to help out, eg holding our bags on check-out for several hours. Breakfast time can be fairly busy and chaotic, not very different from most other hotels. The trick is to arrive 15 mnutes outside of peak period between 08:30-09:30. If you don't, expect some frustration, although once again the hotel staff do work hard to get everyone seated quickly. There was a good fruit & veg market further up the Canal on a Sunday morning and the Young Person's Hostel next door was great for cheap(er) food & drink in multi-national campus-like environment. Be careful with the Metro system, it certainly IS NOT step free access so if you have heavy bags be ready for some heavy lifting, in hindsight, much better to go by Cab from your arrival Terminus.

Reviews.Title: “All right for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: PDoherty44
Reviews.Content: We were okay with it as it was only for one night. Hotel was very good but the area not suitable to walk in at night. Police everywhere! Mixture of nice and unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Honest view”
Reviews.Author: Crx1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of five in two rooms for 2 nights at the end of October. The positives- excellent clean adequate rooms. Good location for metro which is very good for centre of Paris Some very good restaurants nearby if you use trip advisor Lovely canal side setting The negatives- inadequate bar and service. Very limited breakfast Otherwise feel free to go as it was for us and the kids a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in mixed neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JaniceHolland
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits on the Canal de la Villette. Unfortunately that is what we found most impressive, period. The hotel is modern and "green" environmentally, but so much so that my husband couldn't locate an outlet in the room to plug in his CPAP breathing machine. There was no closet in the room, and just some configuration of weird shelves. The lighting at night was too mod...not providing enough light for reading. This hotel is very new and state of the art, but a little over the top in conservation. The neighborhood changes dramatically by night, when all the midday high-tech workers go home. The area seems of an ethnic mix, which is fine in itself, except when you find yourself the only Caucasians walking around at night. The metro 1 1/2 blocks away could only be reached by walking through a narrow street with groups of men hanging out. I was glad I was with two male family members. I think this area needs a few more years before blossoming. When I asked the hotel clerk where to find restaurants and such, she circled the faraway 4,5,6,7,8, Arrondisements as where I would want to head. Telling....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteCS
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best Holiday Inns I have stayed in, and I have stayed in many. This area of Paris used to be pretty awful, but has been redeveloped and is now charming and feels like a real community, safe and French! The hotel is right by the canal, great views. The staff were totally helpful and very nice too, not always the case in Paris. Breakfast was mediocre, but there are local places to have a real Continental breakfast and the hotel recommended a fabulous restaurant for dinner Draco, fibe minutes away. I will certainly stay here again...its not in the centre, but is only 15 mins from Gare du Nord and has Metro close by.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: ebookpunkie
Reviews.Content: It's one of the nicest hotels in Paris. Many other reviewers have captured it well. I try to stay here whenever I'm in Paris. Nothing more to say.

Reviews.Title: “A room by the canal de la villette”
Reviews.Author: Cihat
Reviews.Content: It is certainly a well run hotel with friendly staff at the reception and restaurant. Hotel is near the metro station jut take line 7. Beautiful and interesting external architecture as if you are staying in a huge bamboo cottage by the canal. very peaceful surrending, no problem take a walk by the canal at night or early in the morning. Have your breakfast and go discover magic city Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenlyttle2323
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a group and everyone had a pleasant stay. The hotel is lovely, very clean, modern, and environmentally friendly. Although it is not in the city centre, it is a close walk to four metro stops on various lines and was quiet with a lovely view of the canal. Breakfast was good. While we ate most of our meals in the centre, we did eat dinner one night by Juares stop, and it was delicious and very authentic and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: forte22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating 40 years of marriage and we had a great experience at this hotel. The staff are very friendly. the room is big by anyones standards. The elevator is huge. The breakfast room was fine too. The hotel is located in an ethnic area and that is not a problem. my wife and I returned late at night and were never worried. The hotel is steps from 3 metros. we traveled every day on the metro and felt safe and were happy for the experience with the locals! The canal and the pretty white drawl bridge add to the sight! The neighborhood offers a huge grocery store and also little "mom and pop" stores. The Jewish bakery down the street is delicious. Again this hotel is clean, comfortable and a great place to enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Seru76
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful time in Paris thanks to this hotel as well. Staff very helpful , metro close by and the view of the canal it's very romantic. Went there with my partner and loved it. Simple, clean and effective . Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “hotel fine....location shocking”
Reviews.Author: JoyNelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during July with family. Hotel was fine, clean, spacious enough for us but the location is not good or safe. You must watch out for pick pocketers ( especially on the underground) and all the scammers who are round and about. Even in the heart of Paris they are there. Experienced in McDonalds of all places having a ball of fire crackers thrown inside by a group of young black coloured youths.Security guard wandered in 5 minutes later as if this was an every day occurance. Also, what appeared, from the amount of fresh blood on the floor, to be a stabbing also took place. We were so pleased to get out of Paris that we all said (5 of us) we would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, WiFi only in Lobby (surcharge), loud music from downstairs....”
Reviews.Author: jcarp831
Reviews.Content: The rooms, staff and location were good. Clean and big rooms, friendly & helpful staff, 5 min walk from Riquet Metro station. There was music coming from the bottom floors into the late night, sounded muffled though. Biggest downfall is that wifi is only available in the lobby for €5 for 3 hours or €15 for 24 hours. No wifi available in rooms. The area is still developing, some surroundings don't seem very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not so sure about the location”
Reviews.Author: Cristina F
Reviews.Content: The hotel its very nice, modern and eco-friendly. The complimentary breakfast its delicious amd very extensive. We get the room that has a terrace, and I loved it. Its very spacious, and the terrace has 2 comfy chairs and a view of the Canal de la Villete! The location its fine. Its a neighborhood that its becoming popular, and out of the always full "downtown" Paris. The metro its about 5 blocks from the hotel, and the lines(Crimee/Laumiere) are a little far from the sightseeing, but perfect for the Gare du Nord. Apart of this, I have nothing bad to say about the hotel. I loved it, and the staff were kind and easy-going.

Reviews.Title: “good but rude...”
Reviews.Author: georgios123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you expect from a chain hotel by holiday inn ,so no surprises here.The room was decent and the breakfast was good. The location is not central but there is a metro station nearby .The canal was pretty nice also. But we do have some complaints. First we arrived at the hotel at 13.50 and the room was not ready yet!!! The receptiom lady was not polite and not apologetic at all about that.We finally got our room at 15.30. We didn't say anything due of politeness and because we felt that was not a major thing .But on the day of the check out we arrived at the hotel only 10 minutes after 12 and that seem to be a very big problem to them!!! We found the same reception lady knocking at our room door at 12.10 and said to us in a very rude way that we have to check out immediately!!! So they weren't too anxious to give us our room(90 min after they were supposed to) but they were very anxious to get rid off us only 10 minutes after the check out time...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: feibeesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and the hotel is quiet, clean and modern. Much better equipped and less basic than the Ibis Hotels that I stayed prior to this. I stayed in a canal facing double room and it was clean, large and quiet. Breakfast was simple but perfectly adequate. Contrary to many reports of long queues, I always managed to secure a table during the peak time of 8 to 9am. Metro station is 5 minutes away which was the reason I chose this hotel. It is on line 7 which runs straight to the Louvre and passes Gare De L'est. 10 to 20 minutes Metro ride to all Paris attractions. Another plus is that there's a huge supermarket adjacent to the Metro stop and plenty of restaurants including a McD. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: EvaGk
Reviews.Content: Great Holiday Inn Express Hotel; great price ninety pounds with buffet breakfast, situated by a very lively canal in a very lively french neighbourhood and near friendly bistros and restaurants, not to mention the proximity to the metro. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and a good base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Yiannij
Reviews.Content: We had 2 interconnecting family rooms and there was ample space for a family of 5 including 2 teens. The rooms were clean, staff very helpful (we needed a pharmacy during our stay and tips on best way to travel to Disney). Breakfast is included, and yes the breakfast room is small - but in our 5 days there the longest we had to wait for a table was 10 mins on Saturday morning (and you wait in the lounge area rather than in a queue). The area is what you'd expect of the outskirts of a major city - a bit shabby and rough as you walk from the metro, but certainly nothing to worry about. The hotel itself is in a quite gentrified part of the district - lovely to walk along the canal in the evening. The OKAY cafe over the bridge is friendly and good value. Arriving from Charles de Gaulle take the RER to Gard du Nord then take the Metro. We followed advice from other reviewers and headed for Riquet station on line 7, which means a change a Gare de l'Est. But to avoid having to change lines, its quicker (and easier with suitcases!) to take Line 5 instead to Laumiere station - its only 2 stops and no changes, and brings you out on the other side of the canal. From Laumiere metro station it's 10 mins walk to the hotel - exit onto Av de Jean Jaures and turn left. At the traffic lights turn left (there's a sign to Canal de la Villete) and walk past the shops/supermarket and over the bridge - hotel is on your left. The hotel is a good base for travelling into Paris - its worth buying a 'carnet' of 10 single metro tickets for 12.90 from a ticket machine in any station, instead of paying 5 euros each if buying individually. Use Riquet metro station for travelling into Paris from the hotel. If you are seeking 5* luxury, then this isn't the hotel, or the district for you. But if you're after a good, clean, friendly 3*, and you're happy to use the metro, then I'd really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Chekie2011
Reviews.Content: I was staying there with my parents in a triple room. I personally quite like the design of the room and the facilities provided. The breakfast is excellent. This hotel is situated near the canal. The view from our room is awesome! We usually have a short walk after our meal. If you are coming from Charles De Gaulle airport, you can take the train to Gare Du Nord station, then from there take metro to Riquet station. The hotel is just 5 – 10 minutes walk from Riquet station.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JHMharp
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here and had a wonderful experience. Despite being told that we would have an inside room, we were given a room with a canal view, including the Crimee drawbridge. The room was spacious and clean (much larger than rooms in other Paris hotels we've stayed at). We loved having breakfast included, and we did not have to wait for a table, but that was because it was just the two of us. There was quite a selection: scrambled eggs, sausage, cold cuts, cheese, cereals, breads, croissants, pain au chocolat, yogurt, fruit. We used the Crimee metro stop which is only slightly closer than the Riquet stop. There are good restaurants near the hotel (Okay Cafe, Draco, Criee) and small cafes along the canal. There is a market near the hotel every Thursday and Sunday. The Paris Plages had been extended to the Canal this summer and had nightly dancing and morning Tai Chi. We loved going out to see the dancers every night before or after dinner. We would have loved free Wifi, at least in the lobby, but we found lots of parks around the city that had wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIM-MQN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a 4-day visit in Paris. Very nice hotel in nice surroundings. The standard was good, and the personell were friendly and helpfull. The only negative is overcharged rates for internetconnection, and an undersized breakfastroom. Interesting neighborhoods as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, good price for paris”
Reviews.Author: corrado8
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Paris from Dublin for a 4 day trip with a friend. Spent ages on various websites looking for reasonably priced hotels that were comfortable with good access to the city centre. Problem with Paris (and London) is that you take a bit of a risk with cheaper hotels: they tend to be of indeterminate quality. Anyway, this Holiday Inn Express is situated 3 mins from Metro (line 7) which runs to many of the main sites (Louve, close to Notre Dame etc). Takes about 15-20 minutes to get to say, the Louvre from the Hotel on the Metro. The area where the hotel is located is not particularly touristy (good in my opinion) and is situated near a canal which was quite pleasant to walk along - lots of cafes near the upper end. Overall, the hotel itself was good: pleasant staff, clean, comfortable if small rooms. Pity internet wasn't included in the price, but I think that HI have a policy of charging for it. There is a bar below the hotel (Belushi's) which is quite good fun, and they serve pretty decent burgers. A couple of other little cafes (one opposite the main entrance to the hotel) looked pretty good (lots of locals) though we didn't try them. I wouldn't visit Paris in August again though. The crowds / queues for the main attractions (Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower) were unbelievable. The day we tried to visit the Louvre there was a sign up saying estimated queue time to be around an hour. We went back the next day and entered via the Carrousel (near the Metro exit) and didn't have to queue at all - everyone else was queuing upstairs near the Pyramid! Overall, I would recommend this hotel. However, if you have children it might be better staying somewhere more central since trying to navigate the Metro with them might become a chore after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby1909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago and were lucky to have a room facing the canal. The hotel feels very new. Everywhere is very clean. The location of the hotel is great, after having stayed in many hotels in Paris which always seem to be on busy side streets. Enjoyed walking from the hotel along the canal where there are places to have a drink and activities to join in with. Very convenient for the metro station Riquet. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marja-Alain
Reviews.Content: Nice holiday express hotel. We had a view on the canal de la Villette. The room was basic but spacious, comfortable bed. Five minutes working from the subway. Breakfast was included but it was full up, there were people everywhere and very noisy. The food was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice room, breakfast could be better”
Reviews.Author: LatourDijon
Reviews.Content: This seemed a brand new hotel. Location is nice. The room has a view over the canal. By metro you is quickly in the centre of Paris. Secured parking below the hotel. There were not enough seats in the restaurant, so be ready to wait for some time during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the canal!”
Reviews.Author: COLO_USA
Reviews.Content: Very nice breakfast included. Pleasant staff. Lovely view of the Seine! Internet not included, should be for 160 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: soumiunq
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable rooms and the air-conditioner worked !!! We were fortunate to have a room overlooking the canal. The ladies at the Reception were very polite and helpful. Breakfast was not lavish, but substantial. The Riquet Metro station is just 5 minutes from the hotel, so travelling into the city was never a problem. At 90 Euro for the 2 of us, it was real value for money. The only drawback was the non-availability of free Wifi. Would love to go back again. Just avoid the La Criee fish Restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service”
Reviews.Author: egrobbie
Reviews.Content: We booked a room 2 months ago. When we arrived last saterday, they were suddenly 'overbooked'. They said the'll send us to a different hotel, they gave us a map en showed us how to walk. When we came to the other hotel, they didn't no nothing about us. The hotelstaff send us to the wrong hotel! After a whole afternoon walking around the nieghbourhood, we finally checked in at the right hotel. A waste of our afternoon, since we stayed only a view days in Paris. We are certainly not happy with the serive at the hotel, you don't treat your guest like that and only say a simple 'sorry' afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staf, clean spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: suetoole
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights and found the hotel and staff really good. Friendly staff and very accommodating. We arrived at 8am in th morning and had booked a three bed room and they were happy to let us go into the room as soon as the chambermaids had prepared it. Staff really hepful and spoke excellent English. Breakfast each morning was fantastic and we rarely needed lunch!! Wait staff were friendly and efficient. Room was clean, spacious and well appointed. Had several destinations we wanted to visit (Monet's Garden, Disneyland) and they gave us all the information so we could catch the train etc. Our departure was half an hour earlier than breakfast opened but they arranged for us to go in early so we could have breakfast before we left. We had a wonderful stay and it was really nice to come back to a friendly hotel after big days of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hunny76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a residential area in Paris, walking distance from the Riquet metro stop. The metro stop is about 5-6 stops away from Louvre so it is a very quick ride to the city center. Across the metro stop is a Casino supermarket and a McDonalds (convenient if you are traveling with a picky 8 year old). The hotel in itself was very clean, they gave us the family room with the canal view. There was no tub in the bathroom, just a shower but that was really all we needed. Breakfast was delicious and there was a decent selection available. Contrary to other reviews, we ate at 9 and the staff kept refilling the buffet table and never ran out of food items. Some complaints I read here on TripAdvisor before making our reservations was that the hotel was in a sketchy part of town. That is not true. Like I said, it is a residential area. Very safe and a few steps away from the metro stop is a police station (you pass by it on your way to the hotel). We came back from the Eiffel tower at 11 pm and we didn't feel unsafe walking back from the metro stop to the hotel. We also had to take an overnight train to Venice at Paris Bercy on our last night there. The staff was very helpful, and showed us the best metro route to get there so we wouldn't have to take a taxi. It took 12 minutes on the metro and we made it to Bercy. The hotel is so convenient, we never had to pay tons of money for taxi fares. The hotel is also a very, very good deal compared to other hotels in Paris. Most of the other Holiday Inns in Paris that were closer to the tourist attractions had bad reviews (not clean, too expensive, etc). Overall, I think this is the best hotel you can get for the price range. I used the Priority Club points + cash option to pay for our room. It was 5,000 points/night plust $60. Rooms usually go for 220 euros so I think I got a very good deal on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JPA1605
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just about 150m from the Riquet metro station and with the Paris metro network, it means that you are not far from any of the Paris attractions. The surroundings of the hotel are also very beautiful, especially the canal, its banks and the numerous boats that are anchored near the canals banks. The room was good, clean, however, the bathroom was very small. The shower cabinet was so small that you bang yourself at least once while taking shower. The room given to us was on the first floor and at least for this room the bathroom used to stink when not in use for a few hours. Especially, on our return to the room from the days sightseeing, the stink used to be very predominant. The charges for the internet were also very high, I paid Euro 5 per hour once and then Euro 15 for the 24 hour rate. The breakfast was good, but the breakfast room was too small for the size of the hotel and used to get very crowded at times. Barring these few negatives, I still feel that the hotel is a good choice for liesure travellers and those wishing to travel by the Paris metro network.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, views and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: cf_the_city_skipper
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I just got back from this Holiday Inn Express in Paris and I'm not one to write an online hotel review, but I will for this one! We loved it. It was such a pleasant surprise because Holiday Inns in the US are just average, road-side one-night stops. This was more like a trendy, boutique hotel located on a quaint canal. Positives: Modern design, very clean, good room rate, WONDERFUL breakfast included (8-10AM: get there early or you could spend 20 min in line), staff was SO friendly and EVERYONE spoke English, close to a metro stop, next to a cute canal (that was quite busy on Friday night with what looked like students hanging out, playing games, eating, drinking, chatting... good, clean fun). And there were plenty of quaint terraces/ pubs to get a bite nearby. It's also only 2 or 3 metro stops from our favorite part of the city- Montmartre (a must see, adorable area). Negatives: You have to navigate the subway to do the major sightseeing- Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, Arc de Triumph, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Very modern”
Reviews.Author: Binaboutalot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 4 nights in March to stay at the Holiday Inn express and I have to say I was a bit more impressed that I expected to be. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. (word of advice if you get a taxi to the Hotel most do not know where it is but if you tell them its Quai Del La Seine they do). The room itself was big and modern, Nice big comfy bed, large TV (only BBC news in English), 2 seater sofa lovely views over the canal, bathroom had super double shower no bath, the only downside was the wardrobe space or lack of it, no drawers only a tiny hanging space and all your bits and pieces are then on display! The breakfast was buffet style not much warm, few sausages, sloppy eggs and thats about it, but nice continental style food. The actual Location was quite good, only 5 mins walk to Riquet Metro (as you come out fo the main reception turn left and 1st right the metro is right at the end on the left), but to get right the way across Paris say to the Eiffel Tower took a good 40-50 mins. There is a nice little bar/eatery right opp the main doors to the hotel which was a nice find the first night in the pouring rain. Also close by is a large supermarket where we bought a fab bottle of French Red wine for about 3 euros. Over all I was happy with my stay here and would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at reasonable price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: World69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 5 nights. Room was clean and quite large. Breakfast was included in the rate and good enough. Not centrally located but there are several metro stops near the hotel (the nearest is Riquet, 3 minutes walking from the hotel) Next to the hotel there are some restaurants, brasserie and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SimonKingston
Reviews.Content: A very nice modern hotel in a great location. The bedroom was very spacious with a view over the canal. Bathroom was excellent. There's a short 3 minute walk to the nearest metro station; from there you can get into Paris in about 15 minutes. Single train tickets are approx 1.5 Euro or you can get a book of 10 for 12 Euro. We drove from Calais in about 3 hours. The hotel has 40 car parking spaces and cost 15 Euro. The staff were very excellent and spoke very good English. There's a very pleasant breakfast room and the inclusive breakfast was to a good standard plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise-clean, modern and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: FayetteBolton
Reviews.Content: Booked just one night here in order to attend an exhibition in the nearby Cite des Sciences et Industrie. I had very low expectations, perhaps due to the location but the hotel was clean and modern. Obviously brand new, the hotel was situated right next to and overlooking the water. Just a quick 5-7 minutes from the Riquet metro station, I was greeted warmly on arrival and checked in very efficiently. The room was reasonably spacious, the bed soft, sheets spotlessly clean. The bathroom was brand new and spotless. I particularly enjoyed the roomy shower with different showerhead options. A good night's sleep was enjoyed. Breakfast the next day was reasonable, plenty of choice and not overly busy. Again the staff were efficient both here and at check out. I would not hesitate to stay here again should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value near Cite des Sciences/Industrie -- great night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: WaziMom
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews of hotels near this convention/congress venue, I was rather depressed. This Holiday Inn Express, however, exceeded expectations of myself and colleagues by a long shot and we agreed we could heartily recommend it. It's about a 3 min walk from the Riquet Metro on line 7 and from Riquet to Cite des Industries et Sciences is about 5 mins on Metro and very short walk at either end of the Metro trip. Just beware, you can only buy Metro tickets at Riquet from a vending machine that only take coins or French bank cards -- so be sure to have some change handy! Best part of this hotel: larger rooms and larger showers than you'd normally expect in Paris; *fabulously* quiet evening -- not a single noise, large firm beds, and shower and bathroom so sparkling clean that you would have thought they'd just been installed yesterday! Have stayed at far pricer places all over Europe that were nowhere near this clean. Shower is also double-size so plenty of space to scrub-a-dub-dub without bumping elbows or getting water on the floor. Room is large enough for a small sofabed and plenty of room to walk around. Telly has millions of FR channels, BBC World, CNN, Arte, Bloomberg, but nothing else international that might be entertaining. Breakfast buffet was acceptable -- cereals, yogurts, bread, etc -- not much choice of juices or breads/pastries, and the cheeses looked a bit old -- but it was all edible and there was *no wait* even when hotel was full, which is quite something. All in all a rather pleasantly surprising conference hotel, better value for money than most. Not an individual or quirky place, but *very* clean, quiet, and workable.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever...you have to stay there”
Reviews.Author: nadeen22
Reviews.Content: First the reception stuff were great and very welcoming,I sent an email for early check in before i went there,so when i was there early,our room was not ready but they gave us another room to early check-in and the whole check in did not take more than minutes. The stuff were always helpful and speaking English fluently ,in addition when ever we asked them for directions,they had the answer. the room was so clean,as if we were the first people to stay at this room,the bath room is very clean and the A/C was perfect in that cold snowy weather, the view is terrific ,on the canal. they had lot of selections in the breakfast with really very good quality,and the stuff at the breakfast room were so efficient and fast,they refill all the items before it's done. I was somehow worried when i reserved online but that was the best 3-stars hotel you can ever stay in, and it has a metro station few steps from the hotel "Crimee". have fun:)

Reviews.Title: “Could be better-”
Reviews.Author: travel_i_adore
Reviews.Content: Location - on 19th district, too, too far to city center. Metro - Ricquet, is about 10-15 mins walk from the hotel. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy but didn't really have issue since I traveled with family and friends. Hotel - construction on the street but the room is nice/comfy and relatively large compared to standard European hotel. It's got all the amenities needed sans wifi/internet. Although there is wifi/internet on the lobby, it cost 5euro for 3hours/ computer cost 3euro for 3mins and 30cents every minute that follows...expensive and you can only use even the wifi in the lobby. Breakfast - great...this is the hotel's ONLY saving grace. Staff - Customer service is not tops. Will I stay here again? Likely NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Been to worse but beware of scams.Mouse in reception.”
Reviews.Author: SONOFDRAKE
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here nov10 - upset immediately when after very stressful drive through paris (many of the roads closed around hotel with no signs) we finally reached the hotel to pull up at the parking area and buzzed to get in - sorry no we can't get in as their security camera doesn't work and they need to see our booking first(despite my obviously english attempts at french). My wife wanders round to their reception and is assured the garage will now be opened....5 minutes later we're still sat in heavy paris traffic looking at a garage door.I get out and use the intercom asking for the 3rd time to be let in....and we are. I complain at reception and get a hostile reaction. Room is fine - nice view of canal - i'd suggest asking for rooms with rear view of canal. No shampoo for shower and no remote control for tv- asked at reception on our way out for meal and was handed them as they do not have pass key. Main problem is their taxis.....stay clear....if you order one at reception you will be RIPPED OFF. First time paid double what the return journey cost in standard paris taxi.Second time in grey volkswagon we were taken on long tour of neighborhood.We knew the route and complained but without success - completely ripped off. Last night we tried the hotel bar - expensive but everywhere is- tried 3 seats and moved on each time as a floor cleaner tried to clean around our feet.Finally moved to comfy seating area near breakfast room - as we arrived a large mouse ran across the floor - we live in a farmhouse so no problems for us but if my mother had been there we'd have needed an ambulance! They seemed indifferent until it ran out and looked them straight in the face then a trap suddenly appeared. Mouse was friendly which can't be said for most of the staff we met who always had something better to do. I'd make the mouse manager. Expect better from holiday inn......book at the standard holiday inn 1km away not this one. PS.breakfasts ok....

Reviews.Title: “OK in emergency”
Reviews.Author: theblackhand
Reviews.Content: We were stranded at Gare de l'Est on account of French railway workers wanting to retire at 25 or something and this was the nearest hotel we could find. Arrived at about 10pm, left at about 6am, so little chance to see much of the hotel. Still, they had shoved another bed in the room for us at very short notice, although at €200/night they did OK. I assume that at longer notice and when there are moe free hotel rooms in Paris, the prices are more reasonable. Reception was efficient and pleasant. The rooms are presumably standard in these hotels; seemed OK to me, all mod cons. We left too early for breakfast. The immediate area looks interesting. The hotel is on the Canal de la Villette, so soome of the rooms have quite interesting views. There is an open area by the hotel, alongside the hotel, with a very lively and god value bar on it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rough area”
Reviews.Author: FrenchTony
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for 1 night to visit the Zenith venue for a concert, the hotel is right on the edge of the canal and we had a great view over it, unfortunatly they are building a new bridge outside, so very noisy, but only 15 minutes walk to venue. But the surrounding area is typical Paris suberbs, a little intimidating for some, and poor resturants etc, expect to travel for anything decent, plus the prices are still high. The hotel rooms are the standard and everything worked, bed better than average in paris and friendly reception staff. The breakfast that come included with the room is poor, cold, cheap during our stay the cafe was mobbed by a Canon group, nowhere to sit and tables not cleaned, had the make a space, big letdown, would rather pay for something better. BUT I have stayed in some truly appaling hotels in Paris, costing the same, so in balance you could do far worse!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast , lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Richy64
Reviews.Content: A good quality hiexpress , our room had a lovely balcony. Nice modern design features throughout. Less than 5 mins from the metro. Good breakfast but would benefit from an improved evening bar meal menu as little choice nearby. Although it's sad on one of the nights we found a mcd's 5 mins away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great on a budget to Paris”
Reviews.Author: LincolnClan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 3 day trip to Paris in this hotel. We had room 503 which had fantastic views over the canel. All rooms and large for Paris and have air con which is great as Paris can get a bit on the hot and clammy side. The rooms have a large king size bed and sofa for chilling on. Tea and coffee can also be made in the room. The bathroom is lovely and modern and has a large power shower which is big enough for two! There are a few restaurants local to the hotel, we ate in MK2 a couple of nights which was fine but a bit pricey (but most of Paris is for dining). Riquet Metro station is just round the corner (just make sure you head for the canel). We bought 3 day metro passes but on reflection a 12 ticket pass would of been better and saved 8 Euro each. My only complaint of the trip was breakfast, if you get down too late if something has gone it doesn't get refilled. On the whole I would strongly recomend the hotel. One final thing The Eiffal Tower is a must after dark.

Reviews.Title: “good value for an out-of-city centre hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bckyweb
Reviews.Content: We liked the location of this hotel, a 20 min walk from the Gare Du Nord and good metro access to Paris city centre. The nearby restaurants were great (hotel restaurant was only open once) and there is a MacDonalds very close in a real emergency! Lovely canal side location with boules and pedalos on a good day! WIFI rather expensive. Breakfast good before 9am, a bit hectic between 9-10am! Pleasant staff, comfy room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Inn Express I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel on points, and as a platinum member of Priority Club we were given room #601. This one, together with #602, have to be the best rooms in the hotel. Top floor, slightly bigger than most, with a huge balcony, and great views over the canal. The area is very lively and a bit noisy at night (when it's not raining, like 3 out the 4 nights we stayed there!), but once we closed the door of the balcony we heard nothing). It's a 3-minute walk to the Riquet metro station, a big Casino supermarket and McDonald's. And there are several restaurants underneath too. Breakfast was great for HI Express, with a big choice, including crêpes. The staff was attentive, and we paid 15 euros/night for parking, which is reasonable enough in Paris. We'd certainly come back to this stylish hotel, especially in we were given the same room again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much sleep on the Canal de la Villette”
Reviews.Author: oxfordmike
Reviews.Content: Location etc - the hotel is a modern atractive building on the basin of the Canal du Seine, near the Periphique in North East Paris. It has an attractive location next to a rather rough part of Paris and is near a metro station. It is though a Holiday Inn Express. Check-in - efficient Holiday Inn Express style. Room - roomy and OK for short stay. Nice bathroom. Comfortable bed. Could not open window (even though it said you could on it, the windows was locked "for reasons of security"). Air conditioning was either off or blowing a blast of icy air. We had it off and room got very hot and stuffy. If we could have opened the window it would have solved problem as it was cool outside - but windows was locked. At about 20 minute intervals through the night there were load banging noises from depths of air conditioning vent (which was turned off). With the stuffy room and the noises we slept very badly. Good breakfast in crowded breakfast room. Generally (apart from the bad nights sleep) the hotel was a rather dissapointing and uninspiring package On our last visit to this area of Paris we stayed at a typical eccentric Parisian. Wished we had stayed their this time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: AradhanaVerma
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is located at Qua De La Seine and is not in the heart of Paris. However its very near to the subway of Riquet and most of the Paris attractions are easily reachable by the Metro. The hotel is situated next to a Canal and looks very beautiful in the night. Check in was very efficient and took less than five minutes. We had booked a double room. Though not very spacious, the room had everything which is normally required. The bed was very nice and comfortable, and there was a sofa thrown in for convenience. Internet facility was there but had to be paid for. Tea-Coffee maker was there in the room. Bathroom was decent sized. Breakfast was included in the room price and was decent. The staff were professional and efficient and even arranged a taxi for us at 4:00 AM in the morning at five minutes notice. All in all, we had a good stay and it was value for money. If one wants to have a comfortable stay in Paris, without paying for the trappings which come with the Central Paris hotels, in my opinion, this hotel would be a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: japat29
Reviews.Content: just got back from a great 5 night stay at this hotel and could not ask for better quality for the price you pay. My family and I thought the service was excellent. They had excellent staff that communicated well in every way. What ever request we asked - either directions, advice or change of money - nothing appeared to be a problem! they always answered with a happy smile. Both lifts worked throughout our stay, ample breakfast, could not fault the cleanliness and felt safe and secure always. I would recommend any one to this hotel and would return to the same place. As for noise from hostel - heard the young people a few times - but hey -they are young and enjoying life. i witnessed no bad behaviour, violence and drunken squabbles. All they were doing was socialising at an hour where most of us would of done the same. It was a good feeling that there are these safe, secure places that young people can go to. We often had a meal at the bar - and even at my age - was made to feel more than welcome. Overall a brilliant, safe and clean hotel. Thank you to all staff concerned. One Happy family.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: max761
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night at the Holiday Inn, and to be honest, it's the best option on that price range. Lovely setting, and the Pompidou 'Paris Plages' really suited the setting. Chilled out area by the canal with a fab place to eat opposite the entrance, that served proper French simple food. Room spotless, and although when we went to bed we could still hear music, it didn't really bother us. The breakfast was standard, and there were hot options, they were gone by the time we went down. A previous poster mentioned one of the lifts being shut off, and we experienced this, but it didn't impede our stay any - who cares about waiting an extra minute for a lift - if you're that bothered, then use the stairs! Paris can be pretty bad for accommodation of this standard, and this is a gem. The Metro is less than 5 minutes away, and it's nice to be in a part of Paris that is not touristyy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would come here again”
Reviews.Author: Marjenta
Reviews.Content: First visit to this hotel and stayed two nights on the fifth floor. Very quiet, comfortable room - good size. Large bathroom and great shower. Everything was very clean/spotless. We travel light and walked here from Gard du Nord in about 20-25 minutes. Breakfast was included in the price and was fine. Staff friendly and helpful. Yes as in other reviews only one lift was working - but didn't bother us. I tend not to sleep well anyway at times, especially when away, so that's a bit difficult to assess - not too keen on having to have the air conditioning on at night - but got a reasonable sleep. I've been to Paris many times over the last 25 years and thought this was a good hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: millervc
Reviews.Content: We intentionally chose a hotel that was outside the tourist areas, and this one indeed was. The neighborhood did not feel unsafe, in spite of some of the other reviewers' comments. There aren't a lot of restaurants nearby, but one across the street was quite good and friendly. The elevator and AC were great! Desk staff typical for Paris - no more helpful than absolutely necessary. Coin laundry nearby with very helpful attendant. Metro station (Riquet) closeby and easy to connect from - just 7 or 8 stops from Opera, for example, and easy to reach Gare NOrd or Gar Est. The room was very comfortable. Internet access is expensive - 5 euros per hour in the room (or 15 euros for a 24 hour period). Three euros per hour in the lobby. Breakfast pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel expensive for what you get-- a basic hotel + location is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Yalie97
Reviews.Content: I will keep this somewhat short. Don't stay here if you want to feel safe and have lots of close by restaurant options or be convenient to any sites. Hotel is connected to a Hostel (don't remember the same) and the students (some were loud but I didn;'t mind) I met who were staying there said it was GREAT! Belushi bar is close. At midnite you can no longer enjoy a drink outside as an fyi. Some Ladies Night drink specials there. Hotel was HOT but room had AC so it was ok. I know it is a GREEN hotel but not sure if that means no AC in the hallways and elevators. Elevators were ALWAYS not working so beware!!! Meeting facilities were decent though so good for meetings/trainings-- just stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing more - you find better in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zinho007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during a seminaire for 3 days. Despite the extra-price that we obtained I have to admit that the cost-quality ratio is not ok. Location of the hotel is for non-experienced Paris tourists far from good as the area is not always safe. But more surprising was the real non-existence of customer friendly services at the reception. For the price that this hotel is asking, you find better then this. Hope the rest of the Holiday Inn Group is better.

Reviews.Title: “All you ever wanted to know about HI Canal”
Reviews.Author: TCUtexan09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night. I had to catch a flight to Prague but I wanted to see the city at the same time. I am an upper scale traveler but like a deal when I see it. Paris hotels are outrageous so I choose this newer hotel on the outskirts of the city. Location- The location is on a serene river. It is a local area. There is almost no tourism in this section of the city. There is a long park out front. There are plenty of locals playing games in the park. There is also a bar right down the street that is very popular. Distance from the center of city is decent. It is not annoyingly far but it is not close. It took about 20 mins to get to the Louvre by train. From the Eiffel tower, it took about 30-45. Paris is so big that this sort of time is expected where ever you go. It is not really bad but just expected. Rating: B Room- The best word to describe it is small. I am in college and this is smaller than my dorm room. So make sure you are staying with someone you know. It is not dreadful but just small. The space between the beds is less than half an arm lengths away. The room was very clean. Although it was small, it was very well designed. They used the space very well. There are not many amenities. It is basic. The bathroom was clean and simple. The bathroom door functions as a door with the toilet as well. A word of warning: the room does not come with real soap and shampoo. It is from a dispenser and is not very good. There is no bar soap which seemed strange. There really is very limited amount of “design” elements within the room. The only thing that came close to that is a small blue light in the bathroom. The shower interface is rather strange and not very well designed. It took me about 20 minutes to figure it out. I eventually got it to work but I still did not know if I was still doing it right. The bed is very nice. It is small as well but very comfortable. The rooms were quiet and the hotel is steel designed so it is hard to hear anyone but those in your room. Rating:B- Hotel- The lobby was very nice. It was not very big but well designed. There was a lot of color and was very clean. The service was efficient and effective. They were courteous and very good at their job. The breakfast provided was simple but filling. I can only see eating there two times. More than that, and it would get tiresome. There were a lot of people down there. It seemed like there were a lot of people there but it was still a quiet place to stay. Rating:B Overall, this would be a good three star. I do not think they want to try harder than that. It would be very easy for them to move up to a three and half. Here are some possible improvements because I do not want to just off critiques. • Thicker Towels • Real amenities • Free internet (why does everyone in Paris charge a arm and a leg for such a basic service) • A little more decoration and features in the room If they did these above things, this could be a very nice three star or a bottom basic four star. Good stay. I probably would not stay again as I like to Hotel hop. There are hundreds of great hotels in Paris. I would put this one as a great place to stay for a getaway from the Center of Paris. It is closer to the airport than central Paris. Stay here if you want a good value, free breakfast, newer rooms, and in between the airport and Paris. Overall: B

Reviews.Title: “Perfect extended weekend”
Reviews.Author: KachkaUmich
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris. We stayed in Holiday Inn Express - Canal de la Villette for 3 nights. The location is convenient - only 2 metro stops from Gare d'Nord (you do have to change though). Hotel was clean, well organized. The rooms are quite small (there were 3 of us), however, we managed. After all, if things go well you don't really do much more then spend the night. We had the hotels breakfast and were very pleasantly surprised - fresh pastry, fresh bread, nice sandwich meat, plenty of diary and fruit products were available. The only two issues I would mention are that not all members of the staff have fluent English skills; and that the breakfast on Sunday was way simpler than on other days (no explanation was given for this).

Reviews.Title: “Modern friendly & comfortable eco hotel with great Parisian canal views!”
Reviews.Author: bunnyo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis that it had excellent reviews and recommendations both on Tripadvisor and the Eurostar Website. I have to say that they were not far wrong, and got what I expected. Holiday Inn Express in my opinion are a well trusted brand name, and commonly stand for value for money, good comfort (but no frills) and centrally placed for your destination. I understood that Paris-Canal de la Villette wasn't necessarily going to be bang in the centre of Paris and expected a tube/taxi ride into the city. I primarily chose this one as it was the nearest to the Gare du Nord (only 2 stops on the underground / 2km) and it was in the 'quiet' suburbs of the city of Paris. So therefore a trek into the main sights is at least a 5km away. When we first arrived (Riquet underground being the nearest to the hotel, only a 3 minute walk) I was pleasantly surprised by the tranquillity if the setting. The hotel was indeed individual in appearance and sported some pretty unusual balconies (only for show cannot be used). From a glance looked like some woven bamboo wicker rails which were in fact metal on closer inspection. To one side of the hotel was a seafood restaurant (not owned by HI Express) and to the other a cafe bar called Belushis. Holiday inn express only had a small bar but no evening food was served. Everything looked very peaceful (granted it was Sunday afternoon when we arrived); there was a young boy fishing and older gentlemen playing boules in the area outside. After checking in (fault free & friendly welcome) we made our way to the room. The whole the hotel had this very new and futuristic feel to it. But also that eco feel. It was surrounded not only by the canal but also as you entered the glass lift and ascended you were taken through was like a giant vivarium or greenhouse which housed real plants and felt quite Amazonian! Upon reaching the floor you were hit with a wall of heat! Not sure how eco friendly the hotel was (whether it was heated by solar energy or not) but the corridors were certainly very overbearingly hot! I think every radiator was on. We are having a very cool May but this was ridiculous! Once inside our room all the air con was quickly put on and window opened. It wasn’t that warm outside, but the heat from the rooms was nearly as unbearable as the corridors. Once comfortable we made tracks and went out to explore. Only a short walk away (20 -30 minutes along the canal banks) was the nearest attraction, cite des sciences /the science museum (which unlike the UK version isn't free admission). To be honest we probably wouldn't of visited this attraction had we not of being staying out of town. Although it is top on the list of 'must do things' in Paris on the whole so we were quite lucky in that respect. It’s a great place for entertaining the kids and its very interactive much the same as the UK one, and is very futuristic and modern and is built in the grounds of the parc de la villette, a pretty little park that runs alongside the canal. Back to the hotel, I was disappointed not to find many restaurants in the immediate location. In the evening after visiting the science museum we had to really look hard to find anything decent. It was Sunday evening so hard enough as most French shops are closed, they do not have Sunday opening so even the supermarket was closed. We decided in the end to take the easiest option of the seafood restaurant adjacent to the hotel entrance. Here the food was well priced and staff were friendly. If you order fish and chips though, do be warned its not traditional fried fish in batter!! And if you are English maybe ask for the English menu rather than struggling through the French one! There wasnt a lot to do afterwards except go back to the room as the area is rather inactive. All the other decent restaurants were unfortunately out of the district so stayed out late after our sightseeing to eat in the more central restaurants rather than venturing back. The neighbourhood on the Quai de la Seine is a little quiet at times and you may feel rather unsure of venturing out after dark. There are a few down and outs sleeping in doorways too and the smell of urine is quite apparent. The metro thankfully was so easy to use (trains are cheap and frequent) that all the major sights and restaurants were not so hard to get to. Although could of done without a 8-10 stop ride on the tube. One night there was a rowdy party in one of the external student bars on the streets and this did mean that everything could be heard in the dead of night purely because the traffic noise was so minimal and not a lot else was happening. As the rooms are so warm we had to have the large window open (only opens 10cm for safety though). This is an excellent hotel in terms of how clean and modern it is and the beds are the best I've slept in they were the most comfortable hotel beds around. The bathrooms were clean and trendy. No bath, just an extra large shower which was wonderfully hot and powerful. Fresh clean white towels everyday. The rooms are a little pokey but had enough room to get around in without harm. The flatswidescreen TV did have a few rather expensive Pay per view channels (films being a whopping 12 euros!!) So was stuck with BBC world service for the duration! Had a point for high speed internet though if you brought a laptop with you. The value I found was a little poor however, one because of the location and two because of the facilities. The breakfast was 'free' / complimentary and so it should be at 135 euros a night! and you can eat as much as you like which was great. But if the rooms had been cheaper I could have done without the breakfast. It was basically, continental, a few cold meats, baguettes, croissants, toast, yoghurt and juice/tea/coffee. The scrambled eggs was watery and tasteless and the mini sausages were well erm not sausage maybe??! Best eaten burnt with lots of ketchup on (as they were one morning). But this was the only hot choice of food. I would recommend this hotel to somebody who likes the quiet pace of life, and doesn't mind mingling with the locals, there were not many foreign tourists in the district being one of the only hotels in the area and you did feel like part of the broader community of Paris. Next time we visit Paris will chose a more centrally located hotel, but will probably miss the peacefulness at night, ah well I guess you cannot have it all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel within good distance from the centre”
Reviews.Author: uk1raver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend for our anniversary. The hotel was well located to experience Paris without paying the high prices. We purchased a 3 day Visite Paris pass which allowed us unlimited travel on the metro, RER, Bus etc. to visit all the main attractions. The pass also entitled us to a 20% discount on the Euro Disney tickets and the travel there and back! I highly recommend this hotel for a great weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet on the banks of the Canal”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel in March. The hotel is is a short metro ride (one change) from the Gare Du Nord. We had booked two interconnecting rooms and apart from being a bit smaller than we expected met our expectations in every other way. The beds were comfortable and the location and view overlooking the canal was very quiet and scenic. (Rooms with lower number suffixes overlook the canal). We all slept really well both nights. There are no baths but the showers are good (unless you are really tall) and the bathroom door pivots round to enclose the toilet area so two people could be in the bathroom at the same time. Generally the rooms are well designed given the small space. There is open hanging space and shelves for your clothes but there isn't really any space for suitcases. The flat screen TVs include a good selection of recent films and music (at a price). The buffet breakfast was adequate if not desperately inspiring. If you are looking for a charming hotel in the latin quarter, this is not the hotel for you. However if you are looking for peace and quiet a short metro ride from the tourist sights, then this is a very viable option. It's also really convenient for the canal trip along the Canal St Martin towards Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: JBrindle
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, Nora and Daryl at the frontdesk deserve a mention for being the most personable, professional and helpful staff I have ever encountered in a hotel.
