The hotel is only a ten minute metro ride from all the main places in the city, and two stops from La Gare du Nord. It is modern and very clean. The bedrooms are a decent size with very comfortable beds. The bathrooms are roomy and bright with amazing showers. Tea and coffee faciities and a hairdryer are provided, and the staff are happy to provide you with other bits and pieces you may need. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was perfectly adequate and varied. It is worth walking through the local area for shops, bars and restaurants at non-tourist prices. There is a fab bar/restaurant just opposite the hotel which is packed with locals every afternoon and evening.The hotel is located on a redeveloped canal, and although it may not be the most picturesque part of Paris, it is the best 3-star hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: heatherhoward100
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in the centre of Paris but that's not a reason to mark it down really, as I knew this before I booked - that's the only reason it's such good value. Nice location, really close to shops and metro stations, but not many restaurants nearby (bar next door is good - cheap food and wine!) Great room - we had a triple and there was plenty of space for all of us. Bathroom is nice and beds were comfy. Breakfast was good - not a massive selection but most stuff that was there was really nice. All in all - a great, cheap place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Belavady
Reviews.Content: Chose this Hotel, considering that earlier reviews had said the rooms were spacious compared to European standards and also for the ease of speaking English.. Found the room decently spacious.. The best thing though was the location.. situated right by the river and in a quiet neighbourhood, which incidentally is hardly 15- min away from the centre of the tourist area.. The staff were very cordial.. Loved Paris and extended the stay by a day.. The staff were very helpful in re-scheduling my other hotel stays at different locations.. Breakfat too was just right.. The hotel looks amazing in the night, with different colored lights.. Overall, a great palce to stay at a decent price of 90 Eur !

Reviews.Title: “Superb clean and close!”
Reviews.Author: lex_loci_david
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary and modern business hotel for short stays. It is perfect for a day or two in Paris. I liked the: 1. clean room. Spotless. The showers were also massive by Paris standards. The water was sizzling hot! A real bonus after a hard day slogging through the museums of Paris :) ! 2. large room. Big by Paris standards. 3. location. - right by a beautiful canal. - close to paris. Walk to the metro (<5 mins) and then 15 mins to Opera in the heart. Catch the hop on and hop off from Opera to see all the tourist stuff. - <5 min easy walk to a supermarket and McDonalds. - french cafes, restaurants all around. International restaurants are also close. - internet cafe in the building. 4. fluent English spoken by the the front desk. Everyone speaks perfect English and are very helpful. French only speaking staff is something that can really ruin your Paris holiday (in my experience). 5. Easy to get to and from CDG. Took train to Gare Du Nord (8 euro) and then taxi to Hotel (<5 mins was 7 euro there and 6 euro on the return). 6. Breakfast was quite good and is a part of the deal. It didnt have: 1. room safes; 2. a gym; 3. a pool; 4. much of a business center. Bring your laptop or use the internet cafe on the corner. Kids - not really the place for long stays with kids. The canal and a park right next door have play equipment which is quite good. Right out front you can rent bikes and take advantage of the endless bike paths in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in a quiet locality but easy reach of all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Chico_Drogheda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while visiting Paris for the Ireland V France World cup match at Stade de France. While the hotel is located in quiet area of Paris, it is close enough to all the attractions. The hotel is only 5 minute walk from the nearest metro station Crimée and from here you can use the underground network to visit all the attractions. The area itself, while quiet has a number of restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance. We felt very safe walking to and from this hotel, even late at night in our Ireland colours. I suppose as with any city woldwide one should always remain vigilant. I would highly recommend buying a multi day underground pass and if travelling to/from Charles de Gaulle airport you should ensure that your pass includes Zone 6. The hotel itself was very clean and rooms were to a very high standard, fully airconditioned. We stayed in a twin room which had a lovely view of the river Seine. The room had a modern flat screen TV, with all satellite channels and an internet connection. There was also tea/coffee making facilities. As previously mentioned in other reviews, there was very little wardrobe or drawer space in the room, so if staying for a longer period this might pose difficulties. However this was the only downside to an otherwise lovely room. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. No problem was too big to be solved. The breakfast was perfect with plenty of choice from continental style to egg and sausage. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone who doesn't want to be right in the middle of Paris, yet close enough to see this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: CultureVulture
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have stated, the hotel is quite contemporary, immaculately clean, and stretegically situated on the Canal de la Villette to permit beautiful views of the canal and its flanking parks, which were particularly pretty while we were there in autumn. Staff are very friendly and accommodating, asking housekeepers to quickly prepare our room for early arrival and volunteering to secure ice for us when requested it, etc.; breakfast was bountiful and delicious. The Parc de la Villette, with its ultra-modern buildings housing the Cite des Sciences museum, La Geode 360-degree movie screen, and Cite de la Musique concert hall, is just a pleasant 15-minute walk north of the hotel along the canal. It is interesting for a stroll and probably especially fun for children; frequently concerts and festivals take place there. Since the area has a large ethnic population, there are (no great surprise) several good ethnic restaurants and shops. There's a very nice patisserie run by a Jewish family on rue de Crimee about two blocks from the hotel. Unlike a couple of prevoius reviewers, we did not find the working-class neighborhood unsafe or scarry, even returning at midnight. Obviously every traveler should use common sense by not hanging around dimly lighted areas late at night, but there is a police precinct station located in the block-and-a-half between the Riquet Metro station and the hotel, if one were to be worried . This is a wonderful place for those looking to experience a genuine Paris neighborhood rather than just the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a nice setting.”
Reviews.Author: slinketh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, modern and very well maintained throughout and the rooms are cleaned to a very high standard. The room we stayed in had a very good sofa bed which our teenage daughter slept in in addition to the large double bed. Our room overlooked the canal which made it a very peaceful room and it had a very pleasant view - people canoeing up and down on the Sunday morning. It was a lovely walk along the waterside with people playing boules/petanque and table tennis outside. The buffet breakfast was served from 7 until 10 which was a real bonus. The breakfast room was a little busy with quite a few things running out but the staff quickly replaced them - you only had to ask. The reception staff were all excellent and extremely helpful. The nearest metro, Ricquet is only 5 minutes away and it only takes about ten mintes to then get to Opera. We got a taxi from Gare du Nord with our cases which cost about ten euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel a little far from center of town”
Reviews.Author: pandabear6
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 7 am and the rooms weren't ready but they called housekeeping to get one of our rooms ready next. That was a nice touch. While we waited we ate breakfast, which is a really nice buffett with lots of breads, jams, fruit salad, eggs (not very good), sausage, yogurt, juices, coffee, tea, cold cuts, cheese. That alone was worth several Euros as we didn't even have to eat a big lunch. The hotel is about 20 minutes by metro from the main attraction of Paris so you can't stop in to rest in the middle of the day. But the metro station is really close. This is a residential neighborhood so there are a few supermarkets nearby as well as fast food places. There aren't a lot "Parisian" cafes nearby and no touristy places. But we did eat at an excellent Italian restaurant two nights, a Turkish sandwich stand and Lebanese restaurant. These are not the typical French places but they are part of this working class neighborhood. We walked along the canal one evening and there was a furniture flea market. There is also a very large movie theather across the canal and down a little ways. There are several playgrounds nearby and the connecting rooms were very adequate for our family of 5. Pros: the breakfast buffett, the staff was friendly, quiet location, clean rooms Cons: far from tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Stuart W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night for my birthday with my partner, hotel was very clean, and if you get the right room, you can even see the eiffel tower - which is impressive considering some hotels will charge you the earth for a tower view! The area's quite peaceful at night which is nice in a big city. Breakfast was a bit chaotic - they serve more than the average HI Express for breakfast which means the breakfast area gets very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff, great views from canal outside hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rashda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and in a very good location near a canal. I really enjoyed walking along the canal at night and seeing the friendly atmosphere outside. There was also a park near by for my nephews to go and play and they really enjoyed their stay. I would visit this hotel again in the near future, it is also close to the metro about 10 min walk, never the less a lovely place to visit and a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: amby18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in August. Although it is located relatively far from the center of town, it's a nice neighborhood. The hotel is located on the brink of the Seine with a nice passage. The nearest metro station is quite close, so it is easy to get to all other Paris attractions. The rooms are of reasonable size for a family, and nicely maintained. Free breakfast is included. Breakfast was relatively crowded, but of good value. Nice hotel, clean, easy to access, and with reasonable room rates. You can't ask more than that these days....

Reviews.Title: “Great location for several days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mcclure98
Reviews.Content: The HI Expresss is in the 18th, a bit out of the center of the city, but it's a great location to spend a few days away from the city bustle but very easy to get anywhere to in a short time. The Metro stop is less than 5 minutes walk and the staff were very helpful. Having breakfast included in a city that is known to be pricey is a blessing! Rooms are very accommodating and new - all non smoking. Very close to Sacre Coeur and Montmartre. Having the canal right outside was great to walk around and enjoy watching the boats traveling through.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a horrible location”
Reviews.Author: lestarvinmarvin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is my biggest complaint, it is way outside of the city center, and in an area that seems a bit scary at night. My only other complaint is the value. I suggest not to pay more than $110 Euros per night, any more than that isn't really worth it. Everything else was good- the hotel is new, the rooms are very comfortable and clean, and there is free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaisam
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night stay at this Hotel, We read a few of the reviews, which were helpful. But I can say honestly that we had a lovely stay at the hotel. They were very helpful from when we first got there (which was around midnight saturday night) untill the time of leaving. (Monday evening). We came by eurostar, which was fantastic. The only thing was that when we arrived at the station in Paris, we went to ask for directions to the Hotel,at the information centre and, they sent us on a bit of a wild goose chase. We ended up going way to far on the train, when in actual fact we only needed to go one stop, and we would have been almost there. We arrived at the train station about 10 30 pm and eventually found the hotel about 2 hrs later. Its not the Hotels fault though But all in all the Hotel was very good. There was nice selection of food there for breakfast. The service was very good too. Even when we had problems with the Velib bike system in Paris, They were extremely helpful to us in trying to sort it out and translating for us and letting us use their phone to call our bank in the UK and also using their pc for the internet. The metro system is great!! All you need to to is to get a map of the trains and just familiarize yourself with the names of stations. When you do that you can get around quiet easily. Apart from the trouble we had with the bikes which was no fault of the hotel, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel We would definately reccommend this hotel. Especially if you are just sight seeing like we were.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional !!”
Reviews.Author: ViejoTorrance_CA
Reviews.Content: Who would have thought that a H.I. Express could be so enjoyable. The staff were extraordinary, the setting on the canal was really nice and the Metro was real close. We enjoyed our stay here prior to meeting at another hotel for a Globus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful view, not so nice area”
Reviews.Author: ilga6wah
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mom and my 16 year old cousin and we stayed for a week, the room was very clean and spacious and the check in barely took more then 3 minutes, the room was on the second floor and we had a lovely view of the canal, the room had a large double bed and a sofa bed, the toilet was very clean as well. Only downside is that the toilet door can not be locked from the inside! (But not sure if that is since my cousin was listed as a "child" or all the rooms are like that, didn't ask) The breakfast room was very spacious and they had a decent intercontinental selection, however we did not like the scrambled eggs they felt too watery for our taste? The good thing is that they had an elevator which was great for my mom since she is unable to walk long flights of stairs, and the entire hotel is non-smoking which was a relief for me since I have Asthma. The only downside is the area, it is a bit far from central Paris and all the tourist areas, however there are two metro stations that are close by but it takes almost 8+ stops to reach the central areas which was a downside for us because my mom has weak legs and it is very difficult for her to use the metro with all the stairs so we had to depend on the taxi which was quite expensive for round trips from and to the hotel. Plus, I do not advise on walking alone at night since the area felt a bit shady and way too quite in the narrow streets at times, however there are nice bakery shops almost a 5 minutes walk (one closer to the hotel from the other side of the canal as well which is less then 3 minutes walking!) And shawarma shops and general stores and a laundry since the hotel does not have laundry service in house. Other then that it is a great value for money considering the overall cleanliness of the place and I loved the fact that late at night the hotel doors are either locked/guarded by the security which put me at ease, I think it would be better for couples or friends traveling or atleast if the members of the group/family don't have a problem with walking around, otherwise you will end up spending on carfare!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, shortened our stay”
Reviews.Author: mighla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at Ibis hotels, but this time we were scared off by reviews of tripadvisor´s readers, so we booked a ´better´, more expensive, hotel. First, we couldn´t find it by car, no road-signs, nothing, in the town of weird one-way streets. Then, the elevator from the garage didn´t work. There was a note `please use a service elevator`, but without any notion of where it might have been. The other of two elevators, that went from reception area to the rooms worked, but was making a terrible noise, something like an amorous brontosaurus, and the noise went on and on for two days and nights. In the room, we couldn´t open a window, so we asked for another room, but the lady just shook her head, wouldn´t hear of it and told us to use more force. There was only one chair in the room, but there was a big TV, advertising horribly expensive wi-fi internet ( 5 euros per hour) and movies. Breakfast was served in a noisy overcrowded room, and they served worst scrambled eggs we´d ever tasted, with cheap bread and funny fruit salad. The sausages were excellent, though. The hotel was really too far away from anything in Paris, and the Paris itself was so dirty, overcrowded, expensive (a pint of beer was arround 10 euros anywhere), and full of police, and seriously armed soldiers, that we decided to leave earlier. The last morning at around 8 30 am, a cleaning lady forced herself into our room `thihking we´d vacated it`, and when we were checking out, a receptionist called Jenny gave me an evil eye, and never wished us a good trip, nice day or anything hotel stuff usually do. 130 euros per night, plus 15 euros for a car is more than double of what we would pay for a night in that place. We left for Ibis in Luxemburg and had a warm welcome and great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Easy access to Metro”
Reviews.Author: smarcy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on a tour of Paris. It was clean and comfortable, and the staff was helpful and polite. Though it's a little out of the way, the metro is only a 5 minute walk away. Also, the neighborhood itself is diverse & interesting, and there's good food to be had and sights to been seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great place in Paris / one of the Best Deals of 2009”
Reviews.Author: dkouyate
Reviews.Content: This place been built ///across/// one of Paris canals , so the views are outstanding (even have the river cruise boats and such the like on sight) The staff is excellent , and the architects succeeded in making it look eco-friendly with bamboo and such the like. A true lesson on how to ally form and function. This area has been hugely renovated with walking trails along the canal, cinemas restaurants and the like You have a hard time remembering you are in a holiday inn "express" which is supposed to be an entry level proposition An unquestionable great VALUE overall Location issues mentioned by other members works two ways : There a 3 subways stations at a walking distance, some regular buses pass by but indeed you not in the exact center of Paris (still inside it though) , but the subways takes you there in a very few minutes. On another hand the place is quiet and relaxing. Get there if you want a quiet place with a great view, not to far from the "action" wherever it is

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: foggy
Reviews.Content: This is a great bargain for Paris. We stayed three nights (couple and 6 year old daughter) and loved it. Its location is fantastic, overlooking the canal, and a very short walk to Riquet or Crimee metro stations. The area is a "real" neighborhood, unlike St. Germain, Monmartre and other tourist oriented areas. We felt perfectly safe throughout our stay, and it included late night walks. Our room on the 5th floor was large enough to sleep three persons and it was really smart. Smart is the word for the entire hotel, as everything seems to be in place for a reason. It is also in walking distance from Parc de la Villettee, a really fun place for kids and adults alike. Our daughter enjoyed the City of Sciences and loved the 3D dinosaur movie at the Geode. There is also a great seafood restaurant on the ground floor (not operated by Holiday Inn) called La Criée which is part of a French seafood restaurant chain. Food was great and the price just right! Given the price we paid, this hotel will be my first choice for my next Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasternWestSussex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Nice quite location, away from main roads. The hotel is modern, clean and has terrific staff. Paris was very warm and humid when I visited. However, the hotel air conditioning allowed a good nights sleep. I was on the 6th floor where the rooms have balconies, and it was nice to sit out and relax in the morning with my coffee. The room has a large Queen Size bed and a bed settee, and it is large enough for a family. The Bathroom was clean with a shower, and a clever use of doors allows someone to use the toilet in private, whilst someone showers in private. The Hotel room also had a large LCD TV with plenty of cable channels, some of which were in English. Breakfast was good. A huge choice with an all you can eat buffet including hot meats, eggs etc. The Coffee was very nice. I traveled to Paris without a car, and the hotel is 2-3 minute walk to Riquet metro station where you can travel directly to Gare Del'Est, Opera and the Lourve. If you are traveling by car, the hotel has plenty of parking. The hotel does not provide an option to have an evening meal. However, there is a nice looking restaurant next door, and plenty of Cafes near by. Near Riquet Metro Station is a large supermarket to keep you with plenty of water, snacks etc. All in all a nice hotel, with friendly staff who speak fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Class hotel in premier location”
Reviews.Author: suncool
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself spent 5 days in this hotel from 12th May 2009 and found it to be an exceptional hotel in a lovely location just outside Paris. Our delightful room was overlooking the canal with a view of boats as they plied their way down he canal. Brilliant shower in the good size bathroom, no bath, but this not important to ourselves. Large and very comfortable bed and room had all the facilities you would expect from this hotel group including internet connection, tea and coffee etc. Very adequate breakfast served in dining room and staff were very helpful. We used the excellent public transport system, always a good way to get about Paris, and there was a very convenient Metro station close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem - I nearly decided to keep it to myself ;-)”
Reviews.Author: Gi7
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel "par hasard" and were ever so lucky... It is brand new, eco-built, beautifully situated on the canal itself with (if you're lucky to be on the top floor) a beautiful terrace... If we ever go to Paris again, that's where we'll stay (that is if they don't put their prices up of course)... Forgot to say that if I rated 3 on location it is just because it is a little too far from the Centre, but the subway is near and there is a great bistro-brasserie just opposite the hotel which is good food, good fun and nice people...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iqq
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfectly adequate. Clean, good size rooms, nice breakfast included in price. Found the staff very nice and helpful. I really did not like the location though. The distance from central Paris is a factor, and more than that, the area around the hotel is really not very nice. I would not have felt confortable walking at night from the metro. Given Paris prices this hotel ought to be looked at as an option, but if you have only few days in Paris and are with younger family I would really not recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
HotelInfo.Address: 68 Quai De La Seine | 19 Arr., 75019 Paris, France
